page.title: 11THE BEACH IN EAST MERSEA
page.content: In June 1985 a study of the beach revealed two swans,4 cygnets, barnacles, whelks, mussels, cockles, a number of jellyfish and a variety of different seaweeds. On the beach 5 habitats were identified; 1) An area of grassland on the landward margin. 2) This was replaced towards the sea by an area of sand with scattered clumps of grass. 3) The grass disappeared and an area of bare sand was found. 4)The sandy area was succeeded by an area of coarse shingle. 5) At the sea's edge there was an area of finer more compact shingle. People on the beach were interviewed and most of them said they liked the fresh air and quiet and would not welcome commercialisation of the beach
